alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 16 at 8:40AM CDT until April 19 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Illinois River near Tahlequah affecting Cherokee County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Illinois River near Tahlequah. * WHEN...From this morning to early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, no flooding occurs but all recreational floating along the Illinois River ceases at and above 9.5 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.2 feet Monday morning. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
